channel.title: SPOON Documentation on SPOON Site Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in SPOON Documentation on SPOON Site Documentation

item.title: Bulk Upload Process
item.description: You can bulk upload any kind of file to SPOON inside of a zipped folder.

item.title: Developer Guide
item.description: This guide goes over various issues developers would be concerned with, such as how to setup their IDE, what libraries are used, etc.

item.title: Setup
item.description: These are instructions on how to get an instance of the site to run on your personal machine.

item.title: User Guide
item.description: The user guide is in the application help system.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: This guide describes the high-level design of the server and client architecture.

item.title: Custom Submission Forms
item.description: Custom Submission Forms are used when you want to present a custom look and feel to the user when they submit an entry. You can add a form with many required or optional fields depending on the Entry Type of the submission. This form is then shown to the user when they are presented with the fields for a new entry of that type.

item.title: Submitting a New Component
item.description: This article briefly explains how to submit an entry onto SPOON

item.title: Workplans
item.description: This guide reviews how to create and manage a workplan.

item.title: Docker
item.description: The SPOON application contains a Dockerfile in order to build Docker images. There are two dockerfiles in the repo. One is for development which is used by Jenkins to deploy the application for testing of new features. The other dockerfile is for the release build. These can be found in the repo at https://github.com/spoonsite/spoon/tree/master/Docker. SPOON also automatically builds release versions of the application for consumption by users. These builds are available on Docker Hub.

item.title: Front-end Code Standards
item.description: These are the agreed-upon standards for this project.

item.title: Unit Legend
item.description: This is the legend for commonly confused unit names and acronyms.

item.title: Administrator Guide
item.description: This article gives further instructions on setting up and configuring the web application.

item.title: Data Migration Guide
item.description: This guide provide help for importing data from external sources as well as moving data from one instance to another instance.

item.title: User Interface Guide
item.description: These are general guidelines on what the look of SPOON should be.

item.title: Version Migration
item.description: This guide details changes and upgrades that have happened from version to version.

item.title: Server Code Standard
item.description: These are special notes when making additions to the server-side code.

item.title: Security Roles
item.description: Security Roles define what permissions users get in the application. Several default roles are set up with default permissions and are listed below. These can be reset to default or altered as needed. New roles can also be added.

item.title: Evaluators Guide
item.description: This is a complete overview of the user interface to make an Evaluation on SPOON.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions by/for Evaluators

item.title: Create an Evaluation
item.description: This guide goes over creating Section templates, Checklist questions and templates, and Evaluation templates. This guide assumes a librarian has a basic understanding of what an entry is and has an entry that needs to be evaluated. Once the librarian has created checklists and templates, an evaluation can be created.

item.title: Publish an Evaluation
item.description: This guide goes over the different types of publishing and the various scenarios a librarian may run into when publishing an entry/evaluation.

item.title: SPOON
item.description: SPOON Documentation
